channel.title: Comments on: White Chocolate Cones with Nougat and Vienna Almond Semifreddo

item.title: By: Caroline
item.dc:creator: Caroline
item.description: I have made these a couple of times already. They can be made well in advance, which is great when you are hosting a dinner party and are a lot easier to make than they look - your guests will be so impressed.
item.content:encoded: I have made these a couple of times already. They can be made well in advance, which is great when you are hosting a dinner party and are a lot easier to make than they look – your guests will be so impressed.

item.title: By: Yummmmmmy
item.dc:creator: Yummmmmmy
item.description: This looks lovely.....I plan to make it for my dads b'day as he loves white chocolate.....but I was wondering if adding a few chopped up fruits in the cream would taste nice?
item.content:encoded: This looks lovely…..I plan to make it for my dads b’day as he loves white chocolate…..but I was wondering if adding a few chopped up fruits in the cream would taste nice?

item.title: By: Tenina
item.dc:creator: Tenina
item.description: Anita, these are soooo beautiful. Inspirational, LOVE ice cream, love the presentation...
item.content:encoded:
Anita, these are soooo beautiful. Inspirational, LOVE
ice cream, love the presentation…

item.title: By: Miss P
item.dc:creator: Miss P
item.description:
Stumbled on your website yesterday and made these last night..... Thankyou..... they were amazing, everyone loved them. They set in just 3 hours, phew!
Served the remainder just now to the kids, ran out of vienna almonds, so crunched up a few ameretti biscuits, for decoration, which worked very well.
I can't wait to discover more recipes - great site
L x
item.content:encoded:
Stumbled on your website yesterday and made these last night….. Thankyou….. they were amazing, everyone loved them. They set in just 3 hours, phew!

Served the remainder just now to the kids, ran out of vienna almonds, so crunched up a few ameretti biscuits, for decoration, which worked very well.

I can’t wait to discover more recipes – great site

L x

item.title: By: Emma @CakeMistress
item.dc:creator: Emma @CakeMistress
item.description: Holey Moley! That's one impressive looking dessert. I think my eyes would pop out of my head if I got this at a restaurant.
item.content:encoded: Holey Moley! That’s one impressive looking dessert. I think my eyes would pop out of my head if I got this at a restaurant.

item.title: By: Y
item.dc:creator: Y
item.description: Heh, I thought that dessert looked sort of familiar but somehow couldn't place it until you said it was the picture in your blog's header. Duh to me! Congrats on your first year of blogging! x
item.content:encoded: Heh, I thought that dessert looked sort of familiar but somehow couldn’t place it until you said it was the picture in your blog’s header. Duh to me! Congrats on your first year of blogging! x

item.title: By: Von
item.dc:creator: Von
item.description: You're right- this looks like something served at an expensive restaurant! It's so pretty and elegant that I'm tempted to make it- just to look at it! Congratulations on your blog anniversary!
item.content:encoded: You’re right- this looks like something served at an expensive restaurant! It’s so pretty and elegant that I’m tempted to make it- just to look at it! Congratulations on your blog anniversary!

item.title: By: Rilsta
item.dc:creator: Rilsta
item.description: What a clever idea using the baking paper for a mould! The dessert looks stunning, just like at a restaurant! Congrats on reaching the one year mark and I look forward to seeing all the beautiful creations you come up with this year! :)
item.content:encoded: What a clever idea using the baking paper for a mould! The dessert looks stunning, just like at a restaurant! Congrats on reaching the one year mark and I look forward to seeing all the beautiful creations you come up with this year! ðŸ™‚
